Spotify

Principal Product Designer

New York, NY from 2/21/2021

We’re searching for a Principal Product Designer to join our New York-based Free Design team.

Your initial focus will be on Podcast Monetization, diving deep to understand the medium’s unique strengths in order to build exceptional products that serve the needs of advertisers, creators and listeners alike. Podcasting is a critical frontier for Spotify, one that provides creators with a powerful means of sustaining their craft by facilitating conversations through the power of audio. From the perspective of our listeners, you’ll help us challenge the current boundaries of the medium, looking closely at how marketing and messaging can affect and further the user experience. For creators and advertisers, you’ll investigate how we can help unite these parties, finding mutual fit across beliefs, values and audiences while streamlining the production process and removing bottlenecks. How does the UX, underlying logic, systems, and tooling all fit together? You’ll build strategies, prototypes and tools that will bring this vision to life, then work with cross-functional partners across the company to execute against it.

Senior Product Designer - Data Foundations Platform

Stockholm, Sweden from 2/21/2021

In Data Foundation we build the tools and technology that powers all data-related work within Spotify, including personalization features such as Discover Weekly, and the business critical royalty calculations. Our platform is used every day by engineers, scientists, and analysts from all parts of the company, and our work has a direct and immediate impact on how fast Spotify can move.

We are looking for a Senior Product Designer, with solid facilitation, research, visual and service design skills, to work with our Data Foundations team in our Platform mission. You’ll be part of a cross functional team that enables Spotify to efficiently produce, manage and consume high quality data by providing an intuitive and enjoyable platform.

You will have a key role to make working with data within Spotify effortless, efficient, and enjoyable, by interacting directly with our users.

View Full Job Description →



Design Program Manager - Experience Mission

Stockholm, Sweden from 2/21/2021

We are looking for a Design Program Manager to join the Consumer Experience Design team at Spotify.

The Experience Mission is a team of over 550 people who define and drive the Spotify consumer experience across platforms. Our 55 person design team seeks a Design Program Manager to work closely with the Experience Design Director and the existing Design Program Manager. You will work with strategic initiatives across two teams within the mission, to help drive forward design operations, collaboration and processes across our teams.

The role straddles program management and team operations. You will own projects that drive impact for our designers. You will support the day to day operations of our design team that make them work more effectively. You will help foster an internal design culture that is inclusive, educational, creative, celebratory, and collaborative. You will report to the Global Head of Design Operations who oversees a team that supports and elevates the Spotify design community through driving strategic programs of work and cultivating a thriving design community.

Senior UX Writer - Ad Platform, Concerts and Ticketing

New York, NY from 2/21/2021

Help us build the platform that powers promotion at Spotify!

We’re searching for a Senior UX Writer to join our New York-based Ad Platform team, focused on both our Platform and Concerts & Ticketing efforts team — working at this intersection you’ll both build the foundations of our advertising platform and experiment with their direct applications via our Concerts & Ticketing efforts.

We are looking for someone with experience partnering with technology, product and insights teams to drive key company initiatives. Someone who is passionate about developing strategies based on insights from real people, has the proficiency in their craft to turn these insights into frameworks, strategies and content, and who wants to contribute to develop the practice of UX Writing at Spotify.

Ad Platform

Our Ad Platform consists of the foundational capabilities, systems, frameworks and guidelines that underpin all the promotional activity on Spotify. We partner with other teams to turn these foundations into powerful tools for brands, creators and internal teams, as well as intuitive experiences for our listeners. As a Senior UX Writer working on these foundations, you will be positioned to impact spaces where design does not traditionally have a role, defining how design can operate and using our design superpowers for good. This is a team for people who want to think deeply about system design and enjoy being pioneers, who love to partner with other functions and thrive where communication skills are key.

UX Writer - Advertising Experience, Podcasts

New York, NY from 2/21/2021

We’re searching for a UX Writer to join our New York-based design team working on our consumer-focused advertising experience and podcast monetization strategies, partnering with the technology and product teams on our key initiatives. Someone who is passionate about developing strategies based on insights from real people, has the proficiency in their craft to turn these insights into appealingly designed products. Are you someone who is interested in examining how the Podcast listening experience and advertising exist in harmony, both helping brands to reach listeners and propelling podcast creators to make a living off of their art? Come join us!

Senior UX Writer - Ad Studio

New York, NY from 2/21/2021

Join our team to create experiences and tools that help brands and businesses to tell their stories and reach Spotify listeners. In this role, you’ll help build and evolve Spotify Ad Studio, our self-service advertising tool.

You’ll join a cross-functional group working on key strategic and growth efforts for Spotify – looking critically at how we build tools for advertisers, creating best-in-class experiences that grow and thrive within the Spotify ecosystem. We are looking for someone passionate about using their craft to help us create strategies and beautifully designed products. How do we deliver valuable, understandable experiences that provide real value to advertisers in the context of Spotify? How do we balance what’s good for business and our advertisers, with the need to champion, empower, and protect our listeners and the content they come to listen to? How do you empower advertisers of all kinds to become creators themselves?

We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Designer to be a strategic design contributor on a team committed to identifying and crafting differentiated content experiences that will unlock growth with new audiences and help them discover the value of Spotify!
Based in New York, you will be working closely with a multi-disciplinary team of Engineers, Product Managers, Researchers and Data Scientists, whilst balancing input and strategy from Marketing and Business partners to deliver outstanding experiences and solutions for our users and partners alike.

Associate Principal Designer - Backstage

Stockholm, Sweden from 2/21/2021

We are seeking a Design Lead for a high paced team of 8 to 16 engineers, marketers, business developers, and product managers (like a small startup) to test an entirely new technology-focused business line and distribution channel that seeks to meaningfully improve Spotify gross margin. We’re looking for ways to turbocharge the adoption of an already successful open source project and explore then scale outstanding commercial models! Stockholm is the preferred location though the team will likely include members in NYC and London.

Responsibilities in this role will vary frequently. We all wear multiple hats and it's like this role will span external user research, synthesising findings, leading internal workshops, and being responsible for the user journey and experience of Backstage. All while collaborating with multiple teams across Spotify. We want someone who’s passionate about this type of environment!

While we are focused on building out internal tools and infrastructure, we take a human-centric product approach where UX and design is a critical component. Senior Product Designer, Marketplace Core

New York, NY from 2/21/2021

We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to join the Marketplace Core team. You’ll be part of a cross functional team, which provides our organization with a stable platform foundation and simplifies the inextricable complexity of the music industry. Our capabilities seek to solve for the intricacies behind our data, payments, commerce, authorization, teams, and accounts.

As a Senior Product Designer you will help us understand the needs of our customers and elevate design practices throughout the team. There is widespread curiosity and eagerness to experiment with new methods and ways of working. If you're passionate about building platform capabilities for customers and R&D teams, and applying your design thinking to solving complicated problems with solid facilitation, research, and service design skills - then this is the place for you!

Design Manager, Spotify For Artists

New York, NY from 2/21/2021

We’re looking for a Design Manager to lead a growing team of designers and UX writers in developing new features and experiences for artists, managers, and labels within Spotify for Artists. As a Design leader, you’ll guide your team in crafting a design strategy rooted firmly in user insights that paint an exciting vision of the future, and delivering on that vision through effective planning, interaction design, visuals, and prototypes. You’ll also lead cross-functional discovery efforts to explore new opportunities we might pursue to help artists connect with fans and earn a living off their work.

Principal Product Designer - Free Business

New York, NY from 2/21/2021

We’re searching for a Principal Product Designer to join our New York-based Free Design team.

Your initial focus will be on Unified Promotion,building strategies and systems that help us think about our promotional surfaces in ways that are native to Spotify. Spotify is a multimodal experience where listeners are always using it, but not always looking at it. You will be thinking about how our promotional ecosystem works in harmony to better support listener engagement via initiatives like creating frameworks, user protection, attribution and machine learning for Spotify’s promotional ecosystem – and how it ultimately affects our consumer experience. You will be responsible for pushing the craft of design and coming up with strategies and solutions that span a multi-sided experience thinking through implications for marketers and advertisers as well as our consumers.

We are excited to continue to improve our existing offering and come up with new strategies. Our goal is connecting the listeners to the content they love through our promotional touchpoints, while expanding our footprint in the digital audio marketplace, creating best-in-class tools, products and features. We seek to craft innovative new promotional experiences for brands and artists alike that connects listeners to the content they love. We want someone who sees this intersection of advertising and content as an exciting problem space. How does advertising enable great free listening experiences finding a balance of what’s good for business with the need to empower and protect our listeners? Together, we’ll look holistically at how we continue bringing people the content they want while making our Free experience smarter, contextually appropriate, and relevant.

View Full Job Description →

The teams you will work with are still learning how to work with UX, but there is widespread curiosity and willingness to try out new methods and ways of working.
